titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Leland Starnes, Director of the Yale Dramatic Association, Records
Leland Starnes, Director of the Yale Dramatic Association, Records
titlestmt.author: compiled by Mary Caldera

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Friday January 11, 2019 at 09:35

did.unittitle: Leland Starnes, director of the Yale Dramatic Association, records

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The records consist primarily of the production files maintained by Leland Starnes as director of the Yale Dramatic Association (Yale Dramat). Included are prompt scripts, notes, photographs, cast lists, rehearsal schedules, sheet music, budgets, ground plans, stage designs (sketches), programs, posters, sound recordings, and newsclippings. Also included are a complete set of meeting minutes of the Yale Dramatic Association from 1960 to 1968 and a small amount of correspondence.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Forms part of Yale Record Group 40 (YRG 40), Records of Yale clubs, societies and organizations.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

Original audiovisual materials, as well as preservation and duplicating masters, may not be played. Researchers must consult use copies, or if none exist must pay for a use copy, which is retained by the repository. Researchers wishing to obtain an additional copy for their personal use should consult Copying Services information on the Manuscripts and Archives web site.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Original audiovisual materials, as well as preservation and duplicating masters, may not be played. Researchers must consult use copies, or if none exist must pay for a use copy, which is retained by the repository. Researchers wishing to obtain an additional copy for their personal use should consult Copying Services information on the Manuscripts and Archives web site.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Leland Starnes, Director of the Yale Dramatic Association, Records (RU 958). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The records are arranged by accession and chronologically by year of production therein.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The records are arranged in two accessions. The bulk of the records consist of production files maintained by Leland Starnes as director of the Yale Dramatic Association. The files offer a glimpse into the director's creative process through annotated prompt scripts, correspondence, and research notes, as well as to the productions themselves, through cast lists, programs, photographs, sound recordings and newsclippings.
Additional documention on Starnes' productions is included in the Yale Dramatic Association Records (RU 300) in Manuscripts and Archives.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Leland Starnes received his B.A. (1950) and M.A.T. (1951) from Harvard University and his Doctor of Fine Arts from Yale University in 1965. In addition to being the director of the Yale Dramatic Association from 1960 to 1968, he was an instructor of speech (1960-1966) and assistant professor (1966-1967) in the Yale School of Drama. Starnes left Yale in 1968 to become Director of Drama at the University of Pittsburgh.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Yale Dramatic Association was established in 1900.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The records are arranged under two headings: General and Production files, and by size and format. General records consist of programs for Yale Dramatic Association festivals and subscription flyers. The Production files, arranged chronologically, contain records documenting Leland Starnes' productions from 1960-1964. Items in the Posters, Folio, and Audiovisual sections are arranged chronologically, and cross references from the Production files have been provided. An itemized list of the material for each production (play) is available in the first file for the production.

did.unittitle: Yale Dramatic Association Presents Booth is Back in Town! A New Musical , phonodisc (LP)
The Good Soldier Schweik , Richard III , Country Wife

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The records are arranged under two headings: General and Production files, and by size and format. General records consist of a small amount of correspondence and Yale Dramatic Association meeting minutes. The Production files, arranged chronologically, contain records documenting Leland Starnes productions from 1965 to 1968. Items in the Oversize, Folio, and Audiovisual sections are arranged chronologically, and cross references from the Production files have been provided. An itemized list of the material for each production (play) is available in the first file for the production. This accession also contains a few pre-1960 Dramatic Association posters.
